entry.title: Re: Can We Bring “Import Financial Data” to SAP S/4HANA P...
entry.content:
Hello @gunadharshini 

You cannot deploy custom apps like Import Financial Data directly into SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Custom UI5 app hosting is not supported in the public cloud launchpad.

Your current approach using SAP Work Zone with SAP Build Process Automation — is correct and aligns with SAP's recommended extensibility model for Public Cloud.

If needed, you can add a URL tile in the S/4HANA Launchpad that links to your app hosted on BTP.Extensibility Guide – SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (SAP Help)

Extensibility Guide for GROW with SAP

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Demystifying Material Ledger Period-End Closing
entry.content:
Alvaro Alonso Suevis - SAP Senior CO Consultant. TS410 S/4HANA Certified 2022.

Transaction CKMLCP/  Transacción CKMLCP: Material Ledger Period-End Closing. Cierre deLedger de Materiales.

Step by Step Process Detailed.

 

Transaction: CKMLCP.

Costing Run: “0LMAY25”; Fiscal Year: 2025; Period: 05 (May.2025); Application: ACRU (Actual costing).

Click on “Create”.

Click on “Actual Costing run”.

Tab: Plant Assignment

Available Plants: 1149; Assigned Plants: Empty.

Move Plant 1149 from Available Plants to Assigned Plants Frame.

Click on Save button.

Message “Costing run have been saved”.

Click on Tab “Actual Costing” and Collapse General Data.

Collapse General Data.

Click on “icon” “+” on the left of “Processing”: Expand Processing.

A “Flow step” Frame is opened below the “Processing” Cockpit.

Flow step: Selection.

            Click on Parameters:

As we are going to process a single Plant “1149”, deactivate the “Background Processing” option and click on Save.

                        Message:” Values of variant 000000000002 saved. Message No. DB643”.

                        Click on Back or <F3>.              

                                    Click on Selection >> Execute.          

            Results:

Click on Back or <F3>.              

            Results: 2 Successful / 0 Errors. Click on “Save”. Material Status now is green (successful).

            Click on Selection >> Log.

Click on Back or <F3>.  

Close the window “Choose Log” and Click on “Save”.

            Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on the lock of Preparation >> Authorization:

All the Padlocks belonging to the Authorization column for Flow steps Preparation, Settlement and Post Closing are now unlocked.           

Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on Parameters:

Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on Parameters:

As we are going to process a single Plant “1149”, deactivate the “Background Processing” option and click on Save.

<Save>

Values of variant 000000000002 saved

Message No. DB643.

Click on Back or <F3>.  

Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on Execute:

Click on Back or <F3>.              

Material Status now is green (successful).

Flow step: Preparation.

            Click on Log:

 

Click on “Continue”

Message : “Number of inserted MLDOC records: 2”.

Click on Back or <F3>.  

Flow step: Settlement.

            Click on Parameters:

Post Closing >> Parameters.

As we are going to process a single Plant “1149”, deactivate the “Background Processing” option and click on Save.

 

Values of variant 000000000002 saved. Message No. DB643.

Click on Back or <F3>.              

Flow step: Settlement.

            Click on Execute:

Settlement >> Execute.

Click on Back or <F3>.              

Material Status now is green (successful).

Flow step: Settlement.

            Click on Log:

Click on <Continue>.

Number of inserted MLDOC records: 1.

Number of inserted MLDOCCCS records: 1.

Number of updated MLDOC records: 2.

Click on Back or <F3>.              

Flow step: Post Closing.

            Click on Authorization:

Flow step: Post Closing.

            Click on Parameters:

Revaluate Material: Activate.

Revaluate Consumption: Activate.

Set Account Assignment: Activate.

Click on <Save>

Values of variant 000000000002 saved

Message No. DB643

Click on Back or <F3>.  

Flow step: Post Closing.

            Click on Execute:

Post Closing >> Execute.

Click on <Exit>

Material Status now is green (successful).

Flow step: Post Closing.

            Click on Log:

Post Closing >> Log.

Click on <Continue>

Click on <Exit>, 

All flow steps in Material Status Column are in green (successful).

                                   Material Ledger Month-end Closing Finished Successfully. 05.2025 (May.2025)

                                   Cierre de Ledger de Material Ledger Finalizado exitosamente. 05.2025 (Mayo.2025).

Fin de documento / End of the document.

entry.title: Re: compress file into zip with password protect
entry.content:
Hello @JastinC1 

You cannot password-protect ZIP files using ABAP. The available class CL_ABAP_ZIP does not support encryption, and S4 HANA Public Cloud does not allow custom libraries or OS-level tools.

To achieve password protection, you’d need to handle it externally via SAP BTP, using a ZIP library in Node.js, Java, or Python.

KBA-3534013 - Issues Reading .ZIP File of Version 4.5 Using CL_ABAP_ZIP Class Method LOAD

SAP Help Development in the ABAP Environment

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Minha experiência no SAP Inside Track São Paulo 2025
entry.content:
No último sábado (26/07), tive a oportunidade de participar do SAP Inside Track São Paulo 2025, um evento que me deixou motivado e, acima de tudo, grato por fazer parte dessa comunidade incrível.

Desde o momento em que entrei, o clima era de colaboração, aprendizado e inovação. Estar entre profissionais que respiram SAP, ouvindo sobre temas como SAP S/4HANA, SAP BTP, Clean Core, Signavio e SAP Activate, foi como abrir uma janela para o futuro que desejo construir.

Mais do que palestras técnicas, o que me marcou foi o ambiente: acessível, acolhedor e cheio de gente com brilho nos olhos. Profissionais dispostos a compartilhar, ensinar e crescer juntos. Cada conversa, cada slide, cada café compartilhado — tudo fez sentido para quem, como eu, está trilhando o caminho para atuar com SAP S/4HANA em projetos de transformação digital.

Saí do evento com a cabeça cheia de ideias e o coração leve. Reforço aqui o quanto eventos como o SIT são fundamentais para conectar pessoas e ampliar horizontes. Que venham mais encontros como esse!

Parabéns a todos os organizadores, palestrantes e participantes. Vocês fizeram a diferença!

entry.title: Re: Multiple billing documents that contain items from ju...
entry.content:
Hello @Kaito2 

You can’t split one delivery into multiple billing documents directly via OData API like you can in the Fiori app. The API (API_BILLINGDOCUMENT_SRV) doesn’t support interactive item selection or partial quantity billing.

 To achieve the same result, you need to

  • Manually split the delivery items/quantities on your side
  • Call the API multiple times with separate payloads, each creating a billing document for a portion of the delivery

API_BILLINGDOCUMENT_SRV – SAP Business Accelerator Hub

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: The SAP Extended Warehouse Management FAQ Series: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Integration
entry.content:
Many customers are running standardized processes for their Finance, Controlling and Order Management processes in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud are searching for options to integrate advanced warehouse management functionalities to cover their logistics process requirements and help them to grow their business.

With SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition 2508 a new scope item enabling integration of SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud with EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud will be available, to combine standardized cloud ERP processes to be integrated with advanced warehouse management capabilities.

With this blog post are discussing questions and interesting information around the integration of SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud.

Which release is required to setup the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud integration?

With SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 a new scope item will be shipped - SAP EWM for SAP S/4HANA Integration (7L1). This includes the new communication scenario Logistics - S/4HANA Extended Warehouse Management Integration (SAP_COM_0A58) that enables the integration of transactional data to a decentral EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud or OnPremise.

Minimum required SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud release is 2023, FPS0 if batch master data distribution is not required. Otherwise, SAP S/4HANA Private Cloude release 2023, FPS3, introducing the batch master data distribution via DRF is the required minimum release.

Which functional scope is supported in the integration?

The following processes are supported in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud integration to a decentral EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud:

Process

Scope Item

Inbound processing from supplier

2VJ - SAP EWM Integration - Inbound Processing from Supplier

Outbound processing to customer

2VK - SAP EWM Integration - Outbound Processing to Customer

Delivery based production integration: Production supply and goods receipt

2VM - SAP EWM Integration - Delivery-Based Production Integration

Customer returns

2VO - SAP EWM Integration - Customer Returns 

Batch management - Creating batches in: 

•       SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ERP system

•       SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition EWM system

2VN - SAP EWM Integration - Batch Management

Stock transport orders

2VL - SAP EWM Integration - Stock Transport Orders 

What do I have to know about the technical setup of the integration?

To setup the integration there are cut-over, customizing and integration settings required to establish the integration from SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud via SAP Cloud Connector and vice versa via WebSocket. Please find detailed information about the integration via official Set-Up Instruction - Setting Up SAP EWM for SAP S/4HANA Integration (7L1).

Which deployment scenarios are supported?

We are supporting the integration of a single SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud tenant (with or without Cloud WM) to a single EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance. Additionally, a further SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance can be integration to the same EWM for SAP S/4HANA.

Please note that the SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud instance can only be used as a decentral EWM logistics system as the integration of multiple SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC systems to EWM on SAP S/4HANA embedded not supported (see also SAP Note 3376453 - SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS00, FPS01, FPS02 and FPS03: Release information and restrictions for EWM in SAP S/4HANA).

Are there any restriction to be considered implementing this integration to EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud?

There are functional restrictions for EWM on SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud integrating with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to be considered. These can be distinguished by supported processes and integration capabilities managed via Control Parameters for ERP Version Control.

Please find a list of most important processes and functions not supported in the integration in the table below:

Process/Functions

Details

Handling Unit Management in EWM in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

Handling Units can only be managed within SAP EWM. They are not integrated into SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition. Handling Units created in EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud are not transferred to deliveries in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Serial Numbers on warehouse level

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition offers Serial Numbers on the document level (A), the warehouse level (B) and the stock level (C). SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition only offers Serial Numbers on the (A) document and (C) stock levels.​ Serial Number on document and stock level supported for integration scenario only.

Transport Integration – Shipment (LE-TRA) – Transportation Unit

Integration of Transportation Units via SHPMNT05-Idoc to LE-TRA component (Shipments) is not supported in SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud integration.

Integration with SAP Transportation Management (TM)

The integration with Transportation Management (e.g. Via Transportation Units or Advanced Shipping and Receiving) I not supported.

Find a complete list of restrictions and learn more about the new integration between SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and EWM for SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud via SAP Note 3629180 - Supported Processes for EWM Integration with SAP_COM_0A58 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and Higher.

entry.title: Doubt Regarding Web Channel Activation
entry.content:
Hi,

 

A few days ago, I submitted a ticket to support team where I explained that Web Extend is currently not tracking website behavior events because the site isn’t integrated with Emarsys yet.

Given this context, I’d like to know: do I need to wait for the website to be fully connected to Emarsys before I can move forward with Web Channel integration? Or is there anything I can already do in the meantime to begin the setup?

Thanks in advance for your guidance on the next steps.

 

Best regards


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Doubt Regarding Web Channel Activation
entry.content:
Hello,

In order to use Web Channel, you don't need to be collecting events but the Web Extend main script must be installed and functional in your website. You can read more details about the requirement to work with Web Channel at the SAP Help document below:

  • SAP Emarsys Help: Getting started with Web Channel

Best regards,

SAP Technical Support

entry.title: Re: Process for Manual Completion of the Open Deliveries
entry.content:
Hi,

I agree that VL_COMPLETE can be very useful, but (actually in capital letters) you really have to know what you are doing there.

In the case you are describing (delivery with one item is rejected via process code O001) you would be fairly save to use VL_COMPLETE. But you should understand why you have an error queue on the ERP side (you are not elaborating on that) beforehand.

In any other (more complex) case you might mess up a situation quite badly. What if you have several items, some already fully picked and packed? Would you still just delete the queue and do VL_COMPLETE? Well, rather not, I assume.

I have seen VL_COMPLETE being used without prior analysis ... not much fun for the people who had to "clean up" afterwards 😉 So, just a suggestion to be thorough and careful.

Regards Andreas

entry.title: Re: Duplicate Records in Datasphere Monitor – Replication...
entry.content:
Dear 

As previously mentioned by my colleague, you could check in the source system how many records are transferred through the CDS View I_PRODUCT in an initial full load. The ODQMON transaction can help with this. 

See the link "How to check ODQMON for Replication Flow Issues."

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/datasphere/4518531178.html

Then, check if there is any truncation in the target table, if it contains the same key as the CDS.

For additional information on replication behavior, the link "Replication Flow Scenarios with Different Load Types" may also be useful.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/datasphere/4518284059.html

If these checks don't find anything, the monitor might be at fault, in which case an incident could be opened to request assistance from the support team.

Regards, André

entry.content:
Hello everyone:
I have a problem with the sales order. My example is as follows:
I have an order with 7 items, the price condition is entered manually, and the total value is entered in the header.

entry.title: Re: Webi Query Filter - Between Formula

worked out! I just had to set the filter after that to exclude "hide"

Thank you!!!

entry.title: Re: Serial number Split scenario EWM
entry.content:
Hi,

If you need to have serial number management active you cannot really split that 1 PCE to pack it into serveral HUs.

Here is an idea to get around that issue - it involves custom development though. We have used a similar idea in the furniture business where e.g. 1 sofa is being shipped in several physical pieces.

  • You pick and pack that 1 PCE of the material in an HU (let's call it "Main HU")
  • For every additional physical HU which you need for shipping you pack a dummy material into a HU (as the only item). You link these HUs to the Main HU by assigning the Main HU number as an alternative HU identification of each HU. Like that you create a logical  group of HUs that are linked to each other.
  • That is fairly straight forward if you pick the serial number managed material and use the dummy material in the packing step only.
  • It gets more complicated if you already want to create the group of HUs when you receive it to the warehouse and even more so if you want to store the HUs in different storage bins (say because you have smaller and lager HUs in the HU group)
  • Note regarding the dummy material: you obviously need stock to be able to pack that dummy material into an HU. So you either need a source storage type which allows negative stock or you create enough stock "out of the blue" to supply your packing step. Material type should be non-valuated, but stock-managed. If you already know that you do need a group of HUs to ship the 1 PCE you can add an order item line for the dummy material. Like that you get an item which needs to be picked and packed.

Happy coding, regards Andreas

entry.title: Re: SAP Screen Personas Errors in log
entry.content:
My first suggestion would be the following:

  • Delete all old versions of your flavors permanently (not just mark as deleted, but remove from database), leaving only the most recent one
  • Compress undo history of the flavors
  • Use the 'Update Object Relations' function in Health Check

These actions will remove old / obsolete references and should hopefully help in getting rid of those errors.

Re: I want to create Busienss Partner with interanl numbe...
entry.content:
Here's the documentation, which says, In the case of internal number assignment, you leave this parameter empty.

Business Partner Number

Description

 

Key that identifies a business partner uniquely in the system for each client.

 

Here you can provide a number when you create a business partner if the number should be assigned externally. In the case of internal number assignment, you leave this parameter empty.

entry.title: Entendendo o Tipo de Item (Item Category) na Ordem de Venda – SAP SD
entry.content:
O que é um Tipo de Item (Item Category)?

O tipo de item determina o comportamento de cada linha da ordem de venda, incluindo:

 

  • Relevância para entrega e faturamento
  • Relevância para estoque (movimentação de mercadoria)
  • Relevância para preço
  • Permissão para entrada de quantidade zero ou valor zero
  • Se o item é apenas informativo ou comercial
  • Geração de requisição de transporte ou não

 

Ele é configurado no SPRO:

SAP IMG → Sales and Distribution → Sales → Sales Documents → Sales Document Item → Define Item Categories

Como o sistema determina o tipo de item?

O SAP usa a chave de determinação de tipo de item, baseada em três elementos:

  • Tipo de documento de venda (ex: OR)
  • Categoria de item do material (Item Category Group no material master)
  • Uso (Usage, opcional)
  • Alta/Baixa de estoque (Higher-level item category, se houver hierarquia)

 

Essa combinação é configurada via transação VOV4, e permite a determinação automática do tipo de item ao inserir o material na ordem.

 

Campos críticos na configuração (transação VOV7)

  • Billing relevance – determina se o item será faturado
  • Item relevant for delivery – indica se gera entrega
  • Pricing – se há cálculo de preço
  • Schedule line allowed – se o item permite cronogramas
  • Completion rule – como o item deve ser encerrado
  • Business data not copied – se dados da linha são independentes da linha pai

 

Impacto funcional do tipo de item

O tipo de item é decisivo para diversos processos integrados, como:

  • Pricing: Define se condições de preço são aplicáveis
  • Logística: Determina se gera entrega ou não
  • Contábil: Impacta no faturamento e contabilização
  • MRP: Pode disparar ou não planejamento de necessidades

O domínio da lógica de tipo de item é essencial para consultores funcionais SAP SD. Ele é a ponte entre o que o negócio quer vender e o que o sistema efetivamente executa.

Na dúvida? Analise o comportamento do item na VOV7 e a chave de determinação na VOV4, isso resolve 90% dos erros funcionais em ordens de venda.

E se você achou o conteúdo importante, deixe um comentário!

entry.title: Best approach to trigger automatic email notifications for COFC error messages in SAP
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We are currently facing recurring COFC error messages in SAP, such as:

"A master record for 11030211/MACH01 exists only in 2021"

This occurs because the system fails to find valid pricing data for old work centers (e.g., SG20). If these COFC errors are not resolved within the current period, they can affect the accuracy of actual activity costs, delay settlements, and cause production variances.

To prevent recurrence, we are considering setting up automated email notifications when such COFC errors are detected. The requirements are:

  1. Automatically send an email to a designated PIC when a COFC error is triggered.

  2. Email title format:
    "COFC error for company code SG10 Plant SG17 as at <posting date>"

Question:
What is the best approach to implement this auto-email setup in SAP?

  • Is it advisable to use a user-exit, implicit enhancement, or custom background job for detecting COFC errors?

  • Which table(s) or log(s) should be monitored to reliably capture COFC-related messages in real-time or batch?

  • Any recommendations for sending formatted email alerts via ABAP?

Appreciate any advice or examples you can share.

Thank you!

entry.title: Customizing GL/AP/AR Overview Reports for Fiscal Year Variant and Profit Center
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

Has anyone successfully customized the General Ledger, Accounts Payable, or Accounts Receivable Overview Reports to include Fiscal Year (13 periods) and Profit Center?

We have a requirement to reflect Profit Center-level reporting, as multiple business units operate under a single company code but act as distinct entities. Additionally, we use a 13-period fiscal year, which we want reflected in the report layout.

We initially tried adding filters to the parameters, assuming it would fulfill the requirement. However, further analysis revealed that these reports are designed for company code-level reporting and retrieve data from BSEG, which limits Profit Center visibility. Adjusting the logic seems necessary.

Given this, has anyone found a workaround or implemented enhancements to:

  • Include Profit Center reporting in these overview apps?

  • Support 13-period fiscal calendars in reporting layouts?

Any advice, examples, or technical guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: DBTABLOG table performance issue
entry.content:
The issue you mentioned in this case about DBTABLOG table, that is kind of complicated.

There is no one trick to kill this issue immediately, there are multi task you need to perform for the finial perpose - better performance on DBTABLOG table .

Here I am summarizing these task for you, you could refer to these note and perform them gradually in the coming period.

1. adjustment for avoiding known issue
3295259 - Unexpected slow performance for DELETE statements against table WDR_ADP_CONST_MP
3325618 - RV80HGEN | Performance issue due massive updates in table DBTABLOG for table TFRM
1834803 - Disable logging of changes on customizing tables

2. reduce table size
2335014 - DBTABLOG | Reduce size
2362854 - Incomplete cleanup of archived long text logs
2388295 - RSTBPDEL | Delete logs periodically

3. add partition
2044468 - FAQ: SAP HANA Partitioning
=>
DBTABLOG HASH LOGID

4. others for your refference
2335086 - DBTABLOG | How to detect tables with the highest number of logs
2161258 - RSTBPDEL performance issue with selection of one or some tables

entry.title: small batch trial production
entry.content:
Dear experts
I have a few questions as follows:
1. During small batch trial production, only semi-finished products are produced, and no finished products are generated. Since the semi-finished products have a procurement type of E50, it is not possible to generate demand and work orders. To generate demand and work orders, the procurement type needs to be changed to E (empty).

2. After formal production begins, the semi-finished products serve as components under the finished products and need to be changed back to virtual items.

3. Some materials were originally purchased with procurement type F, but later changed to in-house production, type E, for small batch trial production. However, this also causes the semi-finished products of other new orders to become in-house production during the small batch trial process.

Are there any good solutions to these problems? thanks.

entry.title: Re: Customizing GL/AP/AR Overview Reports for Fiscal Year...
entry.content:
Hello @Rap1 ,

-Use custom CDS view - fiori app.
-Go for for views that contain both financial transaction data and Profit Center information-for eg - I_GLACCOUNTLINEITEMCUBE.
-Go to "Elements" and select ProfitCenter, FiscalYear, FiscalPeriod, and the relevant key figures (amounts).
-Publish your custom CDS view.
-Now, go to custom analytical query app and select the CDS view.In "Display," drag ProfitCenter to Rows or Columns, and FiscalYear and FiscalPeriod to Columns or drill-down dimensions.
-Add any necessary filters on the "Filters" tab.
-Preview the report to ensure it meets your requirements.
-Publish your analytical query.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback.
Thanks,
Divyesh

entry.title: Re: Customizing GL/AP/AR Overview Reports for Fiscal Year...
entry.content:
Hi Rap1, SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud or Private Cloud ?? 

If Public Cloud have you considered the latest embedded analytical floorplan Review Booklets  ?

There's an app F7763 Cost Center Review Booklet that would be closest. Also you can design your own Review Booklets using the tools in app Manage KPIs and Reports.   

There is a good section on Review Booklets in the learning journey Discovering SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics

If Private Cloud - while not as fancy as the overview pages the app W0079 Profit Centers - Plan/Actuals will give you graphics via the Graphical Display tab. 

p.s.. Review booklets have started to come to Private Cloud but the tools are more advanced in Public Cloud.

entry.title: Re: Leverage High Availability feature of Cloud Connector from ABAP backend System for Service Chann
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"The Cloud Connector have in built product High Available feature, with two node setup, one acting as Master and other as Shadow. For the On-Premise ABAP/Private Cloud ABAP system to be able to call the ABAP Cloud tenant services, a type-3 ABAP connection RFC has to be defined in the backend ABAP system with the destination of Cloud Connector host. In High Available cloud connector setup, the RFC in backend ABAP system fails if it does not have the current master host of the Cloud Connector as defined target host. To bridge this gap, a TCP-Network Load Balancer (Layer 4) is needed between the ABAP system and the Cloud Connector, to redirect the connection to the current master instance of the Cloud Connector."

 

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us a lot.

🙂

 

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: Re: IP Whitelisting Challenge for CPI Tenant
entry.content:
Hi,

Google has 10 years of examples on this. For the installation and configuration of the SAP Cloud Connector, have a look here: https://help.sap.com/docs/connectivity/sap-btp-connectivity-cf/installation. You can install it in your own network or on a vm in a hyperscaler. Once connected to your BTP sub account you can use it in integration flows by setting the 'proxy type' of your HTTP adapter to 'on-premise', see https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/outbound-sap-cloud-connector.

entry.title: SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model - RFA's field customization feature
entry.content:
As you already know we have Remote Function Adapter (RFA) finance functions in our SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model (SAP PaPM Cloud SM) which allows posting of documents to S/4 HANA On Premise using Cloud Connector.  

These RFA finance function types like Finance General Ledger have been offered with its default static field list that can only be adjusted upon feature request - to request for new feature, visit https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/  

As much as the default list is mostly effective to majority of customers, there are still some customers having specific fields and posting needs. 

Due to this, SAP PAPM Cloud SM is now offering a flexible way for your administrators to add the desired finance fields.  

Yes, you've read it right! you can now add your customer's requested fields to have better posting experience. Let me show you how.

First, you need to identify the components that you need.

  1. In your S/4 HANA On Premise, Run SE37 
  2. Display the function module: BAPI_ACC_DOCUMENT_POST 
  3. Choose Tables tab 
  4. Then double click on Associated Type (e.g. BAPIACGL09) 

Now, in order to add these components to your RFA Function follow these steps. 

  1. Go to your SAP PaPM Cloud SM tenant 
  2. Choose Menu > Administration > Settings 
  3. Scroll down to Modeling Settings section 
  4. Then choose the Customize RFA Template button 

From here, you can add the components by choosing the Add Mapping Fields button and then maintain the required fields inside the Add Mapping Field to Your RFA Template popup dialog. For details about the required fields, visit  Modeling Settings on Help Portal.

NOTE: This option is currently available only for  “Finance General Ledger” and “Finance General Ledger Items” RFA types.

Few important reminders:

  1. Once the fields are added in the RFA Settings screen, modelers will need to add a new RFA function in the modeling for the new fields to be visible in the Mapping node.
  2. If you then decide to remove or delete a field that you have added, take note that this field won't be considered for any RFA functions that are using it.
  3. If in any case you are importing an environment coming from SAP PaPM On-Prem version, take note that you need to manually add any components that are new for your SAP PaPM Cloud SM system.

I hope the information provided in this blog post is able to help you start using this new screen and explore it by adding new components for your RFA postings. Until the next new features!

entry.title: Cleanup of /SDF/CC_REL
entry.content:
Dear SAP,

 

This is a generic question as I'm unable to find any notes related to it. 

 

Is there a standard program or functionality which can be used to perform mass deletion on /SDF/CC_REL table? This table has come up as one of the top tables in our DEV system and we are looking for options to reduce its footprint in the database. 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Cleanup of /SDF/CC_REL
entry.content:
Dear ,

 

There is currently no way to reduce the volume of this table. 

CCREF data should only be collected on quality systems, where the coding is stable. It should not be activated on a development system (too much useless data, coding is unstable/evolving) or on a productive system (too much performance impact). 

To delete CCREF data, you can use manual or automatic deletion: 

  • Manual Deletion
  1. Deactivate the References extractor and analysis jobs via SOLMAN_SETUP. 
  2. Delete the content of the tables /SDF/CC_OBJECT and /SDF/CC_REF directly on the managed system
  3. In the Solution Manager system, execute TCode RSA1
  4. Perform a selective deletion from the infocube 0SM_CCREF for the corresponding system ID.
  • Automatic Deletion
  1. In the Solution Manager system, execute the report RAGS_RESET_CCREF. This report will perform remotely (by RFC) the deletion of the CCREF data on the managed system and the deactivation of the CCREF analysis job, and it will also delete the data for this system from the 0SM_CCREF infocube. You simply need to specify the system ID and tick the checkbox for the job un-scheduling. (Note: Be aware that this report can run for a very long time, so you might want to execute it in background mode).

 

Best regards,

Leo

SAP Support
